 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָעַג‎</span>] **verb** ==mock, deride==; also (Niph\`al) ==stammer==, in poetry (Late Hebrew Hiph\`il ***id.***; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְעֵג‎</span> Aph\`el ***id.***; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***stutter*** (compare Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִגְלֵג‎</span> ***mock***, [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַגְלֵג‎</span> ***id.***; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***stutter***, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***id.***)); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָֽעֲגָה‎</span> [[2Kgs.19.21|2Kgs 19:21]]; [[Isa.37.22|Isa 37:22]] ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִלְעַגֿ‎</span> [[Job.22.19|Job 22:19]]; [[Ps.2.4|Ps 2:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִלְעָ֑ג‎</span> [[Job.9.23|Job 9:23]] 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּלְעַג‎</span> [[Prov.30.17|Prov 30:17]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּלְעַג‎</span> [[Ps.59.9|Ps 59:9]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתִּל‎</span> [[Job.11.3|Job 11:3]] 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלְעַג‎</span> [[Prov.1.26|Prov 1:26]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִלְעֲגוּֿ‎</span> [[Ps.80.7|Ps 80:7]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹעֵג‎</span> [[Prov.17.5|Prov 17:5]]; [[Jer.20.7|Jer 20:7]] — ***mock, deride, have in derision***, of Jerusalem triumphing over enemy (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> person or thing) [[2Kgs.19.21|2Kgs 19:21]] = [[Isa.37.22|Isa 37:22]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בזה‎</span>); of the innocent [[Job.22.19|Job 22:19]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׂמח‎</span>); of God (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span>) [[Job.9.23|Job 9:23]]; [[Ps.2.4|Ps 2:4]]; [[Ps.59.9|Ps 59:9]] absolute of wisdom [[Prov.1.26|Prov 1:26]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׂחק‎</span>); of wicked (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span>) [[Prov.17.5|Prov 17:5]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׂמח‎</span>), [[Prov.30.17|Prov 30:17]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בוז‎</span>), [[Jer.20.7|Jer 20:7]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׂחק‎</span>); so also perhaps [[Ps.80.7|Ps 80:7]] (read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָנוּ‎</span> for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָמוֺ‎</span> with [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]] [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]]), compare (absolute) [[Job.11.3|Job 11:3]]. **Niph\`al** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַם ֗֗֗ נִלְעַג לָשׁוֺן‎</span> [[Isa.33.19|Isa 33:19]] ***a people stammering of tongue*** (i.e. barbarians, compare v<sup>a</sup>; but read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נעלג‎</span> [√ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עלג‎</span>] [[BDB#Gr|Gr]]<sup>Monatsschr. 1884, 45</sup>; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִמְקֵי שָׂפָה‎</span>). **Hiph\`il** (late; compare Late Hebrew) ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּלְעֵג‎</span> [[Neh.3.33|Neh 3:33]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּלְעִיג‎</span> [[Job.21.3|Job 21:3]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַלְעִגוּ‎</span> [[Ps.22.8|Ps 22:8]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּלְעִגוּ‎</span> [[Neh.2.19|Neh 2:19]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלְעִגִים‎</span> [[2Chr.30.10|2Chr 30:10]] — ***mock, deride***, always in bad sense: with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> person [[Neh.2.19|Neh 2:19]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בזה‎</span>), [[Ps.22.8|Ps 22:8]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלֿ‎</span> person [[Neh.3.33|Neh 3:33]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> person [[2Chr.30.10|2Chr 30:10]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎השׂחיק‎</span>); absolute [[Job.21.3|Job 21:3]]. — So also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִלְעִיג‎</span> (or <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִלְעַג‎</span>) [[Prov.18.1|Prov 18:1]] for [[BDB#MT|ᵑ0]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִתְגַּלַּע‎</span> [[BDB#Gr|Gr]]<sup>l. c</sup> (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גלע‎</span>, p. 166 above).
